column4: glitz uses automake, in order to generate the Makefiles for glitz use:
$ autogen.sh
What do I do to install it?
uhm, libglitz is packaged, why are you compiling it?
(although you might want libglitz-glx1 instead of libglitz1, i'm not sure, perhaps try both)
no, i'm absolutely not saying that
err yes sorry, i misread, yes, i'm absolutely saying that.
(or you can use Synaptic)
although the package name is either "libglitz1" or "libglitz-glx1", not "libglitz-glx"
alright, well it says that both libglitz1 and libglitz-glx1 are already the newest versions
yet cairo-dock doesn't compile? what's the errors, can you pastebin them? (by the way, while cairo-dock is not in the official repositories, i suspect there is an ubuntu .deb somewhere)
uhm, what's the error precisely, and where did you get the .deb from?
I got it from here http://developer.berlios.de/project/showfiles.php?group_id=8724

that .deb is most likely for Debian, not Ubuntu. try using the one at http://repository.cairo-dock.org/ubuntu/dists/hardy/cairo-dock/binary-i386/, as instructed by https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CairoDock
it installed without errors but it's still giving me the same error when I try to run it
well will you give me the error please
that file belongs to libglitz-glx1. it really should be there if you installed it. what's the output of "apt-cache policy libglitz-glx1 | grep stalled"?
so weird. how are you starting cairo-dock? from the console?
the output of "ls -l /usr/lib/libglitz-glx.so.1" ?
no filename is in red there, right?
uhm, try typing "sudo ldconfig" and then starting cairo-dock again. otherwise i'm at a loss.
